Name: Alstom Coradia iLint Speed: 140km/h Model creation: 2018

History:

The Alstom Coradia iLint is the world's first hydrogen-powered passenger train, developed by the French multinational company Alstom. The Coradia iLint symbolizes a significant step towards greener rail transport and serves as a model for future train developments.

Facts:

This innovative train was introduced in 2018 to provide a sustainable alternative to diesel-powered trains, reducing carbon emissions and noise pollution. It operates with a maximum speed of 140 km/h and features a modern design with passenger comfort in mind.
